title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement pgovan1@aggienetwork.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to ReliaShiny
text: outlines propose change ReliaShiny. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to ReliaShiny
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to ReliaShiny
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to ReliaShiny
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("paulgovan/WeibullR.shiny", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to ReliaShiny
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to ReliaShiny
text: Please note ReliaShiny project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: ReliaShiny
text: Welcome ReliaShiny! ReliaShiny interactive web application reliability analysis. app built using shiny package R. ReliaShiny provides easy--use interface performing reliability analysis using WeibullR ReliaGrowR packages R.

title: ReliaShiny
text: install ReliaShiny R: install development version: launch app:  access app browser, visit govan.shinyapps.io/reliashiny/.

title: ReliaShiny
text: Please note ReliaShiny project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Life Data Analysis
text: Upon launching app, ’ll greeted Landing page. , can: Access Project Site. Download example dataset. Navigate Time--Failure menu.

title: Life Data Analysis
text: demonstration, ’ll use preloaded “Time--Failure” dataset. First, navigate Time--Failure menu click Data sub-menu. stage, app resemble following:  can explore additional options data arrangement, example, ’ll proceed default settings.

title: Life Data Analysis
text: Next, navigate Model sub-menu build Weibull model. app generate Probability Plot using default settings. Feel free experiment different configurations tailor model needs. Next plot, ’ll find additional settings customization.  Finally, visit Contour Plot tab create contour plot. previous plot, various customization options available.

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: Upon launching app, ’ll greeted Landing page. , can: Access Project Site. Download example dataset. Navigate Time--Failure menu.

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: demonstration, ’ll use preloaded “Simple Data” dataset. First, navigate Reliability Growth menu click Data sub-menu. Next, Data Selection box, select “failures” Failure Column. stage, app resemble following:  can explore additional options data arrangement, example, ’ll proceed default settings.

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: Next, navigate Model sub-menu build Reliability Growth model. app generate Reliability Growth Plot using default settings. Feel free experiment different configurations tailor model needs. Next plot, ’ll find additional settings customization.  Finally, visit Duane Plot tab create Duane plot. previous plot, various customization options available.

title: WeibullR.shiny v0.3.1
text: Now support Reliability Growth Analysis including Crow-AMSAA, Piecewise Weibull NHPP, Change Point Detection, Duane models. New tutorials Time--Failure Reliability Growth Analysis. minor improvements bug fixes.
